trans-unit.source: Allows programmatic access to the HTML <xref uid="langword_csharp_<input type= file>" name="<input type= file>" href=""></xref> element on the server.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputFile"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputFile> class.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputFile>.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputControl.Type%2A>|The "file" literal string.|
Gets or sets a comma-separated list of MIME encodings used to constrain the file types the user can select.
Use this property to specify the file type that can be uploaded to the server.
For example, to restrict the selection to images, set this property to "image/*".
> [!NOTE] > Support for this property is browser-dependent.
Check your browser to determine whether it supports this property.
It is recommended that you use server-side code to ensure that the file is of the expected type.
The comma-separated list of MIME encodings.
Processes the postback data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputFile"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputFile> control implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface, which has two methods: <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.LoadPostData%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

The LoadPostData method is called by the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputFile.System%23Web%23UI%23IPostBackDataHandler%23RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A> method and always returns `false`, indicating that the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputFile> control's state is not managed by the ASP.NET page framework.
The LoadPostData method is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputFile> control.
The key identifier for the control.
The collection of all incoming name values.
This method always returns <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the maximum length of the file path for the file to upload from the client computer.
Use this property to specify a limit for the number of characters that can be entered for the path to the file to upload.
> [!NOTE] > Support for this property is browser-dependent.
Check your browser to determine whether it supports this property.
The maximum length of the file path.
The default value is -1, which indicates that the property has not been set.
Raises the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Control.PreRender"></xref> event for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputFile"></xref> control.
If no encoding is specified for the Web page's <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlForm> control, the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlForm.Enctype%2A> property is set to "multipart/form-data".
An <xref:System.EventArgs> that contains event data.
Gets access to the uploaded file specified by a client.
Browser security restrictions prevent this value from being maintained across multiple requests.
A <xref href="System.Web.HttpPostedFile"></xref> that accesses the file to be uploaded.
Notifies the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputFile"></xref> control that the state of the control has changed.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputFile> control implements the <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface, which has two methods: <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.LoadPostData%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method does not participate in the processing of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputFile> control and is included to complete the interface implementation.
The RaisePostDataChangedEvent method is used primarily by control developers to extend the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputFile> control.
Gets or sets the width of the text box in which the file path is entered.
Use this property to specify the width of the text box in which to enter the file path.
The width of the file-path text box.
The default value is -1, which indicates that the property has not been set.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.LoadPostData%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputFile> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface.
The key identifier for the control.
The collection of all incoming name values.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref href="System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputFile"></xref> control's state has changed as a result of the postback; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For a description of this member, see <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler.RaisePostDataChangedEvent%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
This member is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlInputFile> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.IPostBackDataHandler> interface.
Gets the full path of the file on the client's computer.
The full path of the client's file.
An attempt was made to assign a value to this property.
